metadata.title: Convert Degrees to Radians – Angle Converter
metadata.description: Convert angles from Degrees to Radians, essential for mathematics, physics, and engineering calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms angles from degrees (familiar units) to radians (mathematical standard).
Radians are the standard angle unit in mathematics and physics calculations.
This converter uses the relationship where 180 degrees equals π radians.
methodology: 1 radian = 180/π degrees ≈ 57.296 degrees. To convert degrees to radians: multiply by π/180.
Radians are dimensionless, based on arc length. Degrees are arbitrary 360-based divisions.
Scientific and engineering calculations require radians for trigonometric functions.
This converter provides precise angle conversion for mathematical work.
examples: Example 1 – Right angle: 90° = π/2 radians ≈ 1.571 radians.
Example 3 – Common angle: 45° = π/4 radians ≈ 0.785 radians.

faqs.question: Why use radians instead of degrees?
faqs.answer: Radians are natural in calculus and trigonometry. Enable direct arc length calculations.

faqs.question: What is a radian?
faqs.answer: Angle where arc length equals radius. More natural than arbitrary 360° system.

faqs.question: How do I remember the conversion?
faqs.answer: π radians = 180°. Divide/multiply: degrees × π/180 = radians. Radians × 180/π = degrees.

faqs.question: When should I use degrees vs radians?
faqs.answer: Degrees: everyday angles. Radians: math, physics, trigonometric functions.

faqs.question: What is the radian measure of 1 degree?
Why is 180° exactly π radians?
faqs.answer: Radian definition: arc length = radius. Semicircle: arc = πr. So 180° = π radians.

faqs.question: How do calculators handle angle units?
faqs.answer: Most have DEG and RAD modes. Ensure correct mode selected before calculations.

faqs.question: What is an infinitesimal angle?
faqs.answer: Angle approaching zero. In radians, sin(θ) ≈ θ for small θ, enabling approximations.

glossary.definition: Angle unit where circle = 360°. Arbitrary but familiar.
Angle unit based on arc length. Natural mathematical unit.
Distance along curve. Arc length = radius × angle in radians.
Functions like sin, cos, tan. Require radian input in calculus.
